channel.title: ScottHansonDE tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from ScottHansonDE.

item.description: Hearing regular radio ads for the Laura Ingalls Wilder pageant playing n Walnut Grove for 3 weekends this month @elmadaeu
@faerirose @Heather_inDE My mom has some bacon-favored cheese curds in her fridge. Turns out they’re from North Dakota…
Family stuff so I flew to MN a week ahead of my wife. Big branch greeted my mother and me at the side door of the cabin. At least the bench is up this year. https://t.co/Y0nJUuaBhJ
@HejM0 Nah, that‘s what Happy Meals are for
@HejM0 Sorry, I was pulling your leg. But the situation is so weird that any random tweet could apply. 😀
I‘m guessing here in the US NBC will broadcast tape of the Johnson resignation in prime time and pretend it’s live
Late family Mexican lunch https://t.co/XBt269k98w
@HejM0 Is this a Boris Johnson joke?
@jenrazzle It’s better in reverse. When I get up in MN, work day in Germany is nearly done and all problems are either already solved or were not that important anyway! 😛

@jenrazzle @c0urtneyH I’ve had Global Entry for a couple years and it is 100% worth it. I had to wait a few months to get approved and be told to make an appointment, and that was in good times.
@jenrazzle @c0urtneyH Although it didn’t really pay off until my wife had it too. I’d get done with the kiosk in 2 minutes and wait for her 45 minutes to get through the line. And it is a bit creepy to not show your passport and enter on facial recognition alone.
I flew to MSP early, wife is joining me Friday on our original flight. Her first leg HAM-AMS just canceled, she now flies through CDG. Can’t pick seats, but at least she has one. #AirTravelMeltdown
My normal travel schedule to the US qualifies for Silver status on Delta, but I’ve gotten so many apology miles the past year I’ll hit Platinum with my next trip. #AirTravelMeltdown
The good news: my brother is out of the hospital and I’m home with my mother. The bad news: today it will be 95°F (35°C) with humidity to match (95%). https://t.co/HbvG5CjcU4
Good news! The procedure went well and my brother could be released tomorrow or Monday. And the car is being brought here today. https://t.co/zw1lI2Q9dK
Also note that I’ve lived in Germany so long I felt a strong urge to air out my room. https://t.co/7tRF5MbV18
I was able to open the funny American windows! Maybe I should make a YouTube video. (Inside American-in-Germany joke.) https://t.co/Wtcrs7mqqf
@tehnyit Seeing their faces last night made the travel stress well worth it! As for the car, if the mountain will not come to Muhammad, then Muhammad must go to the mountain.

Good morning from Gorecki Guest House at St. Cloud Hospital. My brother is next door for a hopefully routine procedure. My mom is with him 120 miles from home, where she left her car because she can’t drive. I’m now here, also without a car but I can drive. We’ll work this out. https://t.co/XZb2tIX0aq
Taking shuttle from MSP to St. Cloud. From European airport chaos into 4th of July weekend traffic.

@tessaapproves @bzbear2 Maybe there are ingredients not available or not legal here. High-fructose corn syrup? Or maybe they have to use real orange flavoring. Similar reasons why McD strawberry shakes taste different in Germany.
@RealMarkDziak @tessaapproves @MiguelTheGerman So if American Week at Aldi is mostly made-up shit, are their other nation week promotions the same? 🤔

@NuwOne Because of the current situation at airports. We saw a YouTube video from a woman saying she can travel for a month out of a carry-on and a small backpack. I thought I’d try it, and my wife will too when she joins me next week.
@NuwOne I’m usually a chicken guy. And I’ve never been a wine for breakfast guy!

@NuwOne Ha! Would have loved a French breakfast at CDG, but too crowded so I had to wait for “chicken or pasta” on the plane. Funniest thing was the lady on the first leg complaining that Air France did not offer wine at 6:30am!

CDG was chaotic (strikes, but only a bit more chaos than usual for CDG). Passport control took 35 minutes), takeoff was an hour late. Woke up from my nap to see we’re approaching Greenland. https://t.co/jPhdO5cp2V
Just got a mail from Delta apologizing for not loading all checked luggage onto the plane. Crew hasn’t announced anything yet. Good thing I didn’t check anything!
